title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: At Glasterlane Junction (41 miles), a branch line diverges to the right, which is carried over the Lunan Water by means of a fine stone viaduct of nine arciies, and at Friockheim joins the Aberdeen line to

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the left of Guthrie Junction is seen the Kirktowu of Guthrie, with the church and manse ; on the riglit is the old castle of Gardyne, and to the eastward of it Middleton House, and the manufacturing village of Friockheim, with its church and spire.
